title: Be a Part of Inclusive Design: Can You Make This Web Page Better for Everyone?

elements.name: question4
elements.title:
You are invited to participate in a user study conducted by Nadeen Fathallah for her research. This project investigates the effectiveness of Large Language Models (LLMs) in addressing web accessibility violations. The study aims to compare the quality and effectiveness of human corrections versus LLM-generated corrections in improving compliance with web accessibility standards. Please read this Informed Consent Form carefully before deciding whether to participate.

Study Description:
Web accessibility ensures all users, including those with disabilities, can access and interact with web content. This research project aims to compare the accuracy, usability, and effectiveness of web accessibility corrections made by humans with those generated by LLMs.                         

Procedures:
If you choose to participate, you will be required to provide your own corrections to web accessibility violations. Your interactions, corrections, and feedback will be recorded by the researchers for analysis purposes.

Duration:
The study is expected to take approximately 60-90 minutes to complete, depending on the tasks and your familiarity with web accessibility and the tools used in the study.

Confidentiality:
Your privacy is of utmost importance to us. Any information collected during this study will be kept confidential and only used for research purposes after being anonymized. Your personal information will not be linked to the data collected during the study. All data will be anonymized and aggregated for analysis.

Voluntary Participation:
Participation in this study is completely voluntary. You can end and leave the experiment at any time without any penalty or loss of benefits.


Expertise Level:
It is important to note that this study is not evaluating your expertise but comparing human corrections' outcomes with those generated by LLMs. Your participation will help us understand each approach's relative strengths and weaknesses.

Consent:
By agreeing to participate in this study, you acknowledge that you have read and understood the information in this Informed Consent Form. You voluntarily agree to participate in the study and allow the researcher to collect and analyze data from your interactions and corrections.

Please indicate your consent by checking the box below:

choices.text: I have read and understood the Informed Consent Form and voluntarily agree to participate in the usability testing study.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: üß≠ Instructions Each question presents a web accessibility violation; your task is to fix this violation. Here's how to approach it: üß© What You're Looking At: Web page URL: The page containing the issue. Violation Type & Description: Explains what kind of accessibility problem exists (e.g., unclear button labels). Violation Impact: The impact is determined by the severity of the violation, reflecting how much the violation hinders user interaction with Web content. Violation impact range: - Critical: Severe violations that prevent access to essential content. - Serious: Major issues causing significant difficulty in accessing content. - Moderate: Noticeable barriers that hinder user experience. - Minor: Mild inconveniences with minimal impact. - Cosmetic: Minor aesthetic issues with little to no impact on accessibility. Relevant WCAG: Accessibility guidelines that can help you fix the violation. Preview of the Web Page: Visual example showing the issue. HTML Code to Fix: Code with the accessibility issue. üîç What You Should Do: 1. Find the Issue In the HTML code, locate the problem area. Look for a comment like this: This tells you where the issue is. 2. Fix the Code Rewrite the problematic part of the code to fix the accessibility issue based on the description and WCAG guidelines. 3. Submit Your Fix Type your corrected code into the provided text box below the question and submit your answer. üí° Example: Original Code (Violating): Fix: Add Descriptive alt Text Why it's better: The alt attribute provides a text alternative that conveys the same information or function, improving accessibility for screen reader users. üîß Support: If you encounter any issues or have questions during the experiment, please feel free to ask for assistance. We are here to help ensure that you can complete the tasks effectively. Name:

Web Page URL:https://www.w3.org/WAI/content-assets/wcag-act-rules/testcases/qt1vmo/485f10faf222cd48fea2ab3ee79c2d354e51ea33.html

Violation Type:image-alt-not-descriptive

Violation Description: Inaccurate or misleading alternative text that fails to describe the purpose of the image.

Violation Impact Critical

Relevant WCAG(Guide to Fix):

  • * 1.1.1 Non-text Content: Images, image buttons, and image map hot spots have appropriate, equivalent alternative text.Images that do not convey content, are decorative, or contain content that is already conveyed in text are given empty alternative text (alt="") or implemented as CSS backgrounds. All linked images have descriptive alternative text.Equivalent alternatives to complex images are provided in context or on a separate linked page.Form buttons have a descriptive value.Inputs have associated accessible names.Embedded multimedia is identified via accessible text.Frames and iframes are appropriately titled.

<script>

		}

ACT Rules Format 1.0 - Abstract

The Accessibility Conformance Testing (ACT) Rules Format 1.0 defines a format for writing accessibility test rules. These test rules can be used for developing automated testing tools and manual testing methodologies. It provides a common format that allows any party involved in accessibility testing to document and share their testing procedures in a robust and understandable manner. This enables transparency and harmonization of testing methods, including methods implemented by accessibility test tools.

This enables transparency and harmonization of testing methods, including methods implemented by accessibility test tools.

elements.name: image_description24
elements.html:
Web Page URL:https://www.w3.org/WAI/content-assets/wcag-act-rules/testcases/aizyf1/b2a671d96ac510ccc6e34dd58a141d13bb196508.html

Violation Type:link-text-mismatch

Violation Description: Links fail to convey their purpose or are ambiguous.

Violation Impact Serious

Relevant WCAG(Guide to Fix):

  • * 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context): The purpose of each link (or image button or image map hotspot) can be determined from the link text alone, or from the link text and its context (e.g., surrounding text, list item, previous heading, or table headers).Links with the same text that go to different locations are readily distinguishable.
  • * 2.4.9 Link Purpose (Link Only): The purpose of each link (or image button or image map hotspot) can be determined from the link text alone.There are no links with the same text that go to different locations.

Violation Description: Inaccurate or misleading alternative text that fails to describe the purpose of the image.

Violation Impact Critical

Relevant WCAG(Guide to Fix):

  • * 1.1.1 Non-text Content: Images, image buttons, and image map hot spots have appropriate, equivalent alternative text.Images that do not convey content, are decorative, or contain content that is already conveyed in text are given empty alternative text (alt="") or implemented as CSS backgrounds. All linked images have descriptive alternative text.Equivalent alternatives to complex images are provided in context or on a separate linked page.Form buttons have a descriptive value.Inputs have associated accessible names.Embedded multimedia is identified via accessible text.Frames and iframes are appropriately titled.

Understanding Climate Change

This page highlights the impact of climate change through data visualization.

Data sourced from Global Climate Watch | Learn more

HTML Code to Fix: 

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <meta name="description" content="A simple webpage about climate change featuring a graph image with accessibility considerations.">
    <title>Climate Change Insights</title>
    <style>
        body {
            font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
            line-height: 1.6;
            background-color: #e0f7fa;
            color: #004d40;
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
            height: 100vh;
        }

        header {
            text-align: center;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        img {
            max-width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 1px solid #ccc;
            box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
        }

        footer {
            margin-top: 20px;
            font-size: 0.9rem;
        }

        a {
            color: #00796b;
            text-decoration: none;
        }

        a:hover {
            text-decoration: underline;
        }

    <header>
        <h1>Understanding Climate Change</h1>
        <p>This page highlights the impact of climate change through data visualization.</p>
    </header>

    <main>
        <img src="https://www.climaterealityproject.org/sites/default/files/graphblog-1.png" alt="A pie chart showing the percentage distribution of diabetes prevalence by age group." />
    </main>

    <footer>
        <p>Data sourced from Global Climate Watch | <a href="#" aria-label="Learn more about climate change">Learn more</a></p>
    </footer>
</body>

Preview of the Web Page with Accessibility Violation:

Renewable Energy Spotlight

Renewable Energy Sources

Exploring the future of clean and sustainable energy

Solar Power Wind Energy Hydropower

Solar Power

Solar energy is one of the most abundant and clean sources of renewable energy. It uses photovoltaic cells to convert sunlight directly into electricity.

Wind Energy

Wind turbines harness the kinetic energy of the wind and transform it into electricity. Wind energy is growing rapidly as a sustainable alternative to fossil fuels.

Hydropower

Hydropower generates electricity by capturing the energy of moving water, usually from rivers or dams. It is a reliable and proven source of renewable energy.

© 2025 Renewable Insights | Contact Us

HTML Code to Fix: 

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <meta name="description" content="A simple webpage discussing renewable energy sources with a focus on solar power.">
    <title>Renewable Energy Spotlight</title>
    <style>
        body {
            font-family: Verdana, sans-serif;
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            background-color: #f4f4f4;
            color: #333;
        }

        .container {
            max-width: 1200px;
            margin: auto;
            padding: 20px;
        }

        header {
            background: #2e7d32;
            color: #fff;
            padding: 20px 0;
            text-align: center;
        }

        header h1 {
            margin: 0;
        }

        nav {
            background: #81c784;
            padding: 10px 0;
            text-align: center;
        }

        nav a {
            margin: 0 15px;
            color: #fff;
            text-decoration: none;
            font-weight: bold;
        }

        nav a:hover {
            text-decoration: underline;
        }

        main {
            margin: 20px 0;
            padding: 20px;
            background: #fff;
            box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
        }

        main img {
            max-width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            margin: 20px 0;
        }

        footer {
            text-align: center;
            padding: 10px 0;
            background: #2e7d32;
            color: #fff;
            margin-top: 20px;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <header>
        <h1>Renewable Energy Sources</h1>
        <p>Exploring the future of clean and sustainable energy</p>
    </header>

    <nav>
        <a href="#solar">Solar Power</a>
        <a href="#wind">Wind Energy</a>
        <a href="#hydro">Hydropower</a>
    </nav>

    <div class="container">
        <main>

Mental Health Awareness

Mental Health Matters

Importance Self-Care Tips Resources

The Importance of Mental Health

Mental health is vital to overall well-being. It affects how we think, feel, and act in our daily lives. Recognizing its importance helps reduce stigma and promotes a supportive community.

Self-Care Tips

Taking care of your mental health is essential. Here are a few tips:

  • Practice mindfulness or meditation
  • Stay physically active
  • Maintain a balanced diet
  • Connect with loved ones
  • Seek professional help when needed

Helpful Resources

If you're struggling with your mental health, don't hesitate to reach out for help. Here are some trusted resources:

Violation Type:button-label-mismatch

Violation Description: Buttons labels are unclear or fail to specify their purpose.

Violation Impact Critical

Relevant WCAG(Guide to Fix):

  • * 2.5.3 Label in Name: If an interface component (link, button, etc.) presents text (or images of text), the accessible name (label, alternative text, aria-label, etc.) for that component must include the visible text.
  • * 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value: Markup is used in a way that facilitates accessibility. This includes following the HTML specifications and using forms, input labels, frame titles, etc. appropriately.ARIA is used appropriately to enhance accessibility when HTML is not sufficient.

Preview of the Web Page with Accessibility Violation:

Sustainable Living

Sustainable Living

Small steps for a greener planet.

Eco-Friendly Tips

Click the button below to reveal practical tips for sustainable living:

Eco-Friendly Tips

  • Reduce, reuse, and recycle wherever possible.
  • Conserve water by fixing leaks and using water-efficient appliances.
  • Opt for energy-efficient lighting and appliances.
  • Support local and sustainable products.
  • Plant trees or grow your own garden to offset your carbon footprint.

© 2025 Sustainable Living Initiative | Contact Us

HTML Code to Fix: 

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <meta name="description" content="A webpage promoting sustainable living with an interactive feature to display eco-friendly tips.">
    <title>Sustainable Living</title>
    <style>
        body {
            font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
            line-height: 1.6;
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            background-color: #f5f5f5;
            color: #333;
        }

        .container {
            max-width: 900px;
            margin: auto;
            padding: 20px;
        }

        header {
            background: #4caf50;
            color: #fff;
            text-align: center;
            padding: 20px;
        }

        header h1 {
            margin: 0;
        }

        main {
            background: #fff;
            padding: 20px;
            border-radius: 8px;
            box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
        }

        button {
            background: #4caf50;
            color: #fff;
            border: none;
            padding: 10px 20px;
            font-size: 1rem;
            border-radius: 5px;
            cursor: pointer;
        }

        .tips {
            margin-top: 20px;
            padding: 15px;
            border: 1px solid #ccc;
            border-radius: 8px;
            display: none;
        }

        footer {
            margin-top: 20px;
            text-align: center;
            padding: 10px 0;
            background: #4caf50;
            color: #fff;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <header>
        <h1>Sustainable Living</h1>
        <p>Small steps for a greener planet.</p>
    </header>

    <div class="container">
        <main>
            <h2>Eco-Friendly Tips</h2>
            <p>Click the button below to reveal practical tips for sustainable living:</p>
            <button id="revealTips" role="button" aria-label="Submit Form">Show Tips</button>

            <div id="tips" class="tips">
                <h3>Eco-Friendly Tips</h3>
                <ul>
                    <li>Reduce, reuse, and recycle wherever possible.</li>
                    <li>Conserve water by fixing leaks and using water-efficient appliances.</li>
                    <li>Opt for energy-efficient lighting and appliances.</li>
                    <li>Support local and sustainable products.</li>
                    <li>Plant trees or grow your own garden to offset your carbon footprint.</li>
                </ul>
            </div>
        </main>
    </div>

    <footer>
        <p>© 2025 Sustainable Living Initiative | <a href="#" style="color: #fff;">Contact Us</a></p>
    </footer>

    <script>
        const button = document.getElementById('revealTips');
        const tips = document.getElementById('tips');

        button.addEventListener('click', () => {
            tips.style.display = tips.style.display === 'block' ? 'none' : 'block';
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>
